snippet: Nine months after Paris put forward Laurent Stefanini as its nominee, the Holy See still has not said whether it would accept his credentials. Nor has it explained the delay.

byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Rome.

abstract: Vatican delay in confirming Laurent Stefanini, who is reportedly gay, as French ambassador to Holy See is seen as refusal by French officials; some suggest other factors, such as France's legalization of same-sex marriage, are responsible; episode complicates Pope Francis' seemingly more liberal attitude towards homosexuality.
lead_paragraph: Nine months after Paris put forward Laurent Stefanini as its nominee, the Holy See still has not said whether it would accept his credentials. Nor has it explained the delay.

headline.print_headline: Vatican and France in Standoff on Envoy
headline.main: France in Stalemate With Vatican Over Nomination of Envoy Said to Be Gay
